Reviews.Content: First Class All The Way! This was our first trip to Italy and we stayed in great hotels in Milan, Florence, Rome and Naples. But this hotel was our favorite and when we return, we will stay here again! The ambiance of the hotel is extraordinary! Beautifully appointed from the grand entry and throughout! The staff couldn't have been more warm and helpful to us! Our favorite two are Lodovico and Nassino (sorry this spelling is wrong) at the front desk! I couldn't tell you how well they treated us and went the extra step to make sure our stay was perfect. While we were there the art exhibit was Andrea Stella and it was exceptional. Nassino went so far as to secure a book of his work and had the artist sign it for us! Lodovico secured tickets for us to the Vatican Musuem! These were only two of the things they did for us! We have traveled quite a bit and this personal service was the best ever! Our room was wonderful, the lounge was confortable, the bar area was a perfect place to relax after a full day and the breakfast in the morning was beautifully presented and had more food choices than you could hope for.....great coffee too! This is a rather long review.....we could go on and on! Thank you to all the staff for making our visit to Florence one we won't soon forget! Carol Ann  Osmund Miller, Spokane, Washington USA
Reviews.Author: ozmanSpokane

Reviews.Content: Really liked the Borghese       Great shower head.
Reviews.Author: ms-itchyfeet

Reviews.Content: Great Hotel We loved this hotel. It The rooms were small like most hotels in Italy. The room was very clean and the service was great. They first desk was very nice and they helped us with everything we needed. The bed was comfortable and the room had a nice leather courch next to the bed. The breakfast was great and it had a great variety of food. The bathroom was small and the room was a bit dark, but that was the only downside. I loved the location. It was about a five minute walk from the Duomo so it was just far ehough away to not have the summer crowds but still close enough to everything. We had a great honeymoon and this was a great hotel to start it off.
Reviews.Author: scadroes

Reviews.Content: Good location, good hotel. The Borghese Palace Hotel was a clean, quiet hotel in a great location. This hotel is within walking distance to the Duomo, Palazzo Vecchio, Galleria dell'Accademia, Galleria degli Uffizi and the downtown shopping Area. There were many good restaurants within walking distance of the hotel. The staff was not as friendly or helpful, and the breakfast was limited.
Reviews.Author: Tempe_ArizonaWendy

Reviews.Content: Great location but techno problems My family of four stayed in the junior suite for three nights. The room was quite large and it worked out ok. I agree that the shower is very tiny for such a new hotel and there was hardly any room for putting your amenities around. The staff was nice . The location great .The breakfast ok. The elevator was broken during our stay and after a day in Florence having to climb up to our third story room was tiring. Fortunately I asked the manager to give us a discount and he abliged. Where is the fresh fruit in Italy??????
Reviews.Author: Vitina

Reviews.Content: A Very Good Hotel As with all Italian buildings, this has no external beauty. Once inside things change. Nice foyer/lobby, interesting lift in the central of what would have been the courtyard. This is listed as a boutique hotel, which is small but extremely pleasant. Staff excellent, friendly and helpful. Location excellent, very close to the Duomo, Palazzo Vecchio, Bargello and Uzziffi. The rooms are nice and to a good standard.  There are some excellent restaurants nearby, especially the Boca Negra. Only a couple of minor points against this place, no restaurant, and the rooms may be a liitle dark due to the small windows. Breakfast not inspiring and a little limited.  However, all in all enjoyed the time spent here and would definetly return.
Reviews.Author: Palins_Pal

Reviews.Content: Great Location and Service. We had the pleasure of staying at the Borghese from Nov 1st thru Nov 5th of 2007. the weeks leading to our departure back to italy i was in close contact with the front desk of the Borghese making sure everything was set as this was going to be a special trip with my mother making her first european venture. Not only were we able to check in early, our rooms were fantastic. everything was well appointed - so much so that when people view our room pics, they all want to know about the decor. The location is central and an esay walk to all corners of the city. The Duomo is less than 8 mins away by foot, the accademia maybe 12 and the Uffiizi is so close that you can be there withn 5 mins walk. What made are stay even more enchanting was their terrace. It has a cozy welcoming feel. you can almost feel the presence of Florence's past lives up there. Athough we didnt utilize the spa area, it is pleasing to the eye and very unique in design. the light show bathes the ancient stone and rock walls in soft pastel light and the sauna looks more inviting then the gelato we ate in Piazza Signoria. The staff was very attentive and easily accessible. Like i said above, i was in contact almost daily with the staff and when we arrived, i was excited to learn that they had my reservations booked at La Giostra for that friday night! Talk to them about excusrsions outside the city to either the outlet stores or the many beautiful towns and villages that dot the tuscan landscape. they have a driver/tourguide for hire and the hotel is willing to book a trip for about 110 euros, depending on destination.Great staff, hotel and location....thanks Borghese and i look forward to yet another return visit to flroence.
Reviews.Author: johnsharpe

Reviews.Content: lovely, clean,smart hotel This hotel is perfectly situated in florence. its a stones throw away from everything yet in a quiet street. The hotel itself is very arty obviously, with scuptures and painting every where. the rooms are small but very very smart. The lift is glass so its pretty cool. The breakfast was average. make sure you make time to use the spa facilities. my boyfriend and i usually had the whole place to ourselves so it was fab. A little oasis. Staff were friendly and helpful...although nothing more than you would expect from this type of hotel. Would defo recommend it.
Reviews.Author: delightfuldee

Reviews.Content: okay stay       view from our room
Reviews.Author: Katiee1

Reviews.Content: Beautiful hotel We stayed at the Borghese Palace for 3 nights and it was a beautiful old 18th century palace converted to a hotel with artwork and sculptures in the lobby. A mixture of traditonal and contemporary well done in the decor. The rooms were small but new and contemporary. The winding stairs were nice as well as the rooftop romantic sitting area overlooking the city. It was so close to many historic attractions and the Duomo. There was also a downstairs sauna, spa and work out room. The breakfast was a feast, along with many breakfast items and lovely pastries. There was also a lovely bar open in the evening in the lobby. The staff was courteous and very helpful. It was close to many eating places and lovely shops. We walked everywhere in the city from here. We would stay here again.
Reviews.Author: mmp1

Reviews.Content: Very good hotel       the lobby
Reviews.Author: Vagueos

Reviews.Content: Fabulous location This hotel was in a fabulous location for all the sites in Florence. The room we had was small but when you only need to sleep there it was more than adequate. The bathroom was fine and the shower was bigger than the hotel we stayed in during our next port of call in Rome. The secret of this hotel is the patio on the top floor. Sitting here in the early evening was a peaceful experience - the sound of church bells and the beautiful Tuscany light gave this hotel the edge over many of the hotel chains around the world. The breakfast was adequate but as there were so many other places to eat it didn't matter. There are some fabulous restaurants in the area so you are never stuck for good food.
Reviews.Author: Scarrface

Reviews.Content: Good place. I stayed two weeks at this hotel, end of August until September 2007.The location is excellent; close to the centre (the Duomo is 200 m away).The hotel itself probably warrants its 4 stars, even though it still has a few teething problems. For example, the showerhead in my room needed cleaning (the spray was uneven) and the terrasse on the top floor is noisy (close to the aircon system). That's about all I can hold against it.I was on the top floor and faced the inside courtyard; very quiet. (I did not see any nightclub outside, on the main street.)The reception is very helpful and everyone speaks very good English (I was there for Italian lessons, but I did not reach a very good proficiency).The bed was very comfortable. The room was very nice (but maybe a little small by American standards).
Reviews.Author: mmaann

Reviews.Content: Delightful. Such a great hotel in a brilliant position. Central to everything important and within walking distance of all main sites. The terrace on the 3rd floor though small provided beautiful views across Florence. Staff are polite and very helpful. Breakfast adequate, though limited range. Would stay here again and highly recommend.
Reviews.Author: Melbourne_Mel

Reviews.Content: Great modern hotel close to everything!       bathroom
Reviews.Author: sunnylagirl

Reviews.Content: Great value, excellent location Really good value for a 4* hotel and excellent location within easy walking distance of all the sights in Florence. The hotel and bedrooms have a new, modern decor but it still has an Italian feel. Good breakfast, very friendly  efficient staff, I couldn't find any fault, I loved the hotel. There is no noise from outside not even at weekends. A taxi from the train station to the hotel costs 10 euros. I would definately recomend this hotel for the great value for money and central location.
Reviews.Author: Worcs

Reviews.Content: What a great value! I stayed in the Borghese Palace Art Hotel for four nights in October of 2006 and loved it! This was my first trip to Florence, and since I am a female in her twenties travelling alone, safety was my focus. This hotel was in a very safe location!This hotel is located on a narrow street very close to all the attractions. I was able to walk everywhere in Florence and then sleep like a baby every night.Some have mentioned noise issues, but I had no problem with it. Didn't hear a thing, but I slept with the window closed, so that may be why.The decor in the rooms is very modern, nice and clean. The bathroom was absolutely lovely. Expect small whenever travelling in Europe.Overall, I had a wonderful time and would definitely stay at the Borghese Palace the next time I visit Florence.
Reviews.Author: jbbratch

Reviews.Content: great location, tiny rooms, smelly! This hotel is in a good location - walking distance to shops, the uffizi, and the duomo. It appeared as if it was a fairly recent renovation of a very old building. Decorated in a very modern way. Rooms were tiny to the point of being a nuisance. For example, the shower stall was so small that I could barely bend down to shave my legs (and I'm not a big girl!). Worst of all, they must have been having plumbing problems because the hallways and lobby smelled like sewage. When we asked the front desk about the odor, they denied smelling it, which was simply ridiculous. It was disgusting! I would never stay there again.
Reviews.Author: chitown7

Reviews.Content: A wonderful honeymoon!       Our room
Reviews.Author: Starling1

Reviews.Content: Something you really appreciate! Excellent service! Romantic and modern.... the thermal area is great..the room are the best!!!!!
Reviews.Author: NewYorkParis17

Reviews.Content: Very friendly, GREAT Location My mum, sister and I stayed here mid Feb 07 for two nights over the weekend as a 60th birthday trip for mum.On our arrival we were told that our room had an electrical problem and would not be able to get into it until 7pm. The staff were very helpful and went out of their way to minimise the inconvenience. The great location also meant that we could wander straight into the cetre of Florence. The room was also ready much sooner than they anticipated.The room itself was lovely and spacious and the beds comfy. The Saturday night was a noisy one. We had one of the much commented on back rooms which over look the night club. Definately worth ovoiding if staying on a Saturday night. Breakfast was fab. There was not much choice of hot food if that is what gets you going in the morning but the cold choices were great. The Sunday night was much quieter than the Saturday night. Either that or we were so whacked out from the night before that we slept through it. All in all a lovely hotel with great staff. ovoid Saturdays if poss. if not ovoid the rooms at the back. It is only the noise that brought our rating down to an 'average' otherwise excellent!!
Reviews.Author: Miss-Diane

Reviews.Content: Great Spot in Florence The Borghese Palace Art Hotel is a brand new hotel right in the middle of everything and a easy walk to everywhere. Rooms are new, modern, and very spacious. Breakfast is one of the best we've had in Italy. Back rooms can be noisy which face a disco across the street, but the modern double pane windows do wonders for the noise. Front rooms facing the inside are quite. We would recommend this hotel to anyone.
Reviews.Author: AptosLeone

Reviews.Content: Good Value       bedroom
Reviews.Author: traveler076

Reviews.Content: Disappointed My husband and I stayed here for 3 nights. Our experience with the hotel was very similar to the other previous posts. We were also awakened every single night from the nightclub and the party on the street that began around midnight and continued until 5 a.m. It was very noisy and very annoying. We spent our days and evenings walking around Florence enjoying the sights and looked forward to resting our feet and sleeping at night. That did not happen.We were also not overly impressed with the rooms. Our shower stall was very small and the water from the bathroom sink sprayed all over the place. The water pressure was also erratic. The hallyways are marble flooring so be prepared to hear everything outside your door. The walls in the rooms are paper thin. We could hear the plumbing, hair dryer and light switches being turned off/on in the room next to us. I do expect some noise in a hotel but hearing the water go down the drain in the next room is not typical hotel noise.I wish we had a better experience at this hotel but we didn't. It was very unfortunate and not worth the money or the lost sleep. A hotel should be somewhat of an enjoyable haven after sightseeing for 12-14 hours. I wouldn't recommend staying here.
Reviews.Author: Samantha235

Reviews.Content: Lovely, but very noisy! My husband and I spent 5 nights at the Borghese Palace Art hotel this month. The room was very clean and comfortable, and the bed was without a doubt the most comfortable bed I've ever had in Europe. It was nicely decorated and everything seemed to be in a new condition. The shower was very cramped (as usual) and there was no place to store your toiletries, but overall I was pleased with the condition of the room. The hotel staff were very accomodating, making us reservations for the Uffizi and Accademia (although we really didn't end up needing them during November) and the breakfast staff were warmly welcoming every morning. Food included cereals, fruit, yogurt, breads, pastries, cold meats and cheeses, and one hot dish, as well as juice and coffee. My only complaint is the noise outside of the hotel. We were awakened every single night when the night club across the street (the back of the hotel) let out, and the party on the street got started. They made A LOT of noise. While this is not the hotel's fault, ask for a room in the front instead. Also, the location is fantastic for getting around Florence. I would go back, and be very specific on my room location preference.
Reviews.Author: Lucyspoileddog

Reviews.Content: Nice Hotel Me and my wife booked the hotel for 3 nights. Location is very central and it is close to the main atracctions! The lobby is nicely decorated and they have a nice panoramic elevator. Staff is correct. Breakfast is ok. Rooms are modern and decorated with style, but they could be larger. My room was close to the elevator so it was a bit noisy and we also have a problem with the air conditioner and they couldnt fix it during our stay.
Reviews.Author: riobrasil

Reviews.Content: Great Location, Rooms and Service, Shame About The Noisy Street I stayed 5 nights at the Borghese Palace Art in early November when the weather was fantastic for early winter. The Hotel service at reception and in the breakfast room was most welcoming and the rooms well decorated and comfortable. Breakfast was a very acceptable buffet, fresh and well stocked. You get the feeling that all the staff employed by the Hotel are very pleased to serve you and answer any queries you may have. They don't tell you about it but on Floor 3 there is a delightful little loggia cum open air terrace with views across to Santa Croce and the Florentine Hills. If you stand in one corner with your back to the view, there is a little window set in the wall of the terrace which perfectly frames a view of the Dome of the Dumo and the Campanile. It is a nice quiet little area to sit down and take a drink of something local after a long day doing the tourist haunts. However, the night club mentioned by previous reviewers, is a major let-down. It is open 6 nights a week from 11.30pm to around 4.30am. I couldn't hear any music, just the constant very loud talking, shouting and singing of young people hanging about the road outside literally all night long. Then you had about 30 minutes to 5.00am when the proprietor of the club swept up bottles and other rubbish outside and empty in the rubbish bins along the road. If you stay at the Borghese make sure you ask for one of the rooms that looks over the interior courtyard rather than the street - I am sure the night club noise is not a problem on the otherside of the corridor. Or else invest in some ear plugs. Apparently the Hotel have been trying to get the noise issue resolved with the club and the local Commune but to no avail - yet!The hotel is so centrally located, it could not be better located - 5 minute walk one way and you are at the Duomo and Baptistry; 30 seconds walk to the end of the road and you are at a great 13th century museum - The Bargello - where you can see Donatello's David and many other great pieces of art including some of Michaelangelo's; 1 minute's walk down another road fromt he hotel is Santa Croce (where Michaelangelo and Galileo are buried); about 4 minutes walk away is the Piazza della Signoria with its Palazzo Vechio and the Uffizi Gallery (must sees are the Botticelli's); the Ponte Vechio is about 8 minutes walk (fabulous jewellery shops - so hold on to your credit cards) and the Pritti Palace is about 10 minutes walk from the hotel. The Accademia with Michaelangelo's original David is more like 15 minutes away (its only a copy in the Pizza della Signoria). A little gem just down the same road as the Hotel at no 70, is charming Casa Buonarroti where Michaelangelo lived for a while and which his descendents set up as a sort of memorial to him after he died.When visiting the Duomo, it is well worth visiting the Museo dell'Opera del Duomo just across the road from the Duomo. It has been recently renovated and is beautifully set out in a modern and unstuffy style; here you can see Michaelangelo's Pieta, a number of Donatello's works plus some of the original tools used by Brunelleschi's workmen when building the dome as well as some other very important works of art that were originally installed in the Duomo and Baptistry.There seemed to be a good selection of eateries centrally located and you can buy some wonderful cakes in local patisseries and cafes to take away. If you go to the Ufizzi, it is well worth having a light meal or afternoon snack in their cafe cum bar on the top floor where, given the views and the location, the prices are very reasonable. If the weather is fine, you can sit outside on the terrace and enjoy your food whilst taking in the fine views of the surrounding buildings in the Palazzo Vecchio and across to the Duomo and Campanile.
Reviews.Author: marinablue

Reviews.Content: Can't be beat for the price, but not 4 stars   showReview(5922676, 'full');
